methods.name: busy
methods.description: This represents the busy state of the underlying computation engine, not the busy state of the kernel. The kernel is busy when it is processing a request, but the runtime is busy only when a computation is running.

params.name: busy
params.description: Whether the backend is busy

methods.name: clear_console
methods.description: Use this to clear the console.

methods.description: This event is used to open an editor with a given file and selection.

params.name: file
params.description: The path of the file to open

params.name: line
params.description: The line number to jump to

params.name: column
params.description: The column number to jump to

params.name: language_id

methods.name: show_url
methods.summary: Show a URL in Positron's Viewer pane
methods.description: Causes the URL to be displayed inside the Viewer pane, and makes the Viewer pane visible.

params.name: url
params.description: The URL to display

methods.name: show_html_file
methods.summary: Show an HTML file in Positron
methods.description: Causes the HTML file to be shown in Positron.

params.name: path
params.description: The fully qualified filesystem path to the HTML file to display

params.name: title
params.description: A title to be displayed in the viewer. May be empty, and can be superseded by the title in the HTML file.

params.name: is_plot
params.description: Whether the HTML file is a plot-like object

params.name: height
params.description: The desired height of the HTML viewer, in pixels. The special value 0 indicates that no particular height is desired, and -1 indicates that the viewer should be as tall as possible.

path.description: URI of the resource viewed in the editor

is_closed.description: Whether the document has been closed

is_dirty.description: Whether the document has been modified

line_count.description: Number of lines in the document

position.description: A line and character position, such as the position of the cursor.

character.description: The zero-based character value, as a Unicode code point offset.
